neighbors.name: Commonwealth Edison Co
neighbors.claims: Commonwealth Edison Company (ComEd) is Illinois’s largest electric utility and a subsidiary of Exelon Corporation [U.S. Department of Justice](https://www.justice.gov/usao-ndil/pr/commonwealth-edison-agrees-pay-200-million-resolve-federal-criminal-investigation). In 2020, ComEd agreed to pay a $200 million fine to resolve a federal criminal investigation into a bribery scheme involving Illinois officials [U.S. Department of Justice](https://www.justice.gov/usao-ndil/pr/commonwealth-edison-agrees-pay-200-million-resolve-federal-criminal-investigation) [Engineering News-Record](https://www.enr.com/articles/49740-illinois-utility-comed-will-pay-200m-fine-to-settle-contract-bribery-scheme). The utility actively participates in McHenry County renewable energy development, having constructed a switching station for the Pleasant Grove Solar project [Shaw Local](https://www.shawlocal.com/northwest-herald/news/government/2021/12/26/mchenry-county-board-gives-green-light-to-riley-area-solar-farm/) and interconnected the McHenry Storage Project, a 20 MW battery storage facility [EDF Renewables](https://www.edf-re.com/press-release/edf-renewable-energy-announces-commercial-operation-first-battery-storage-project/). ComEd has also received federal funding for high-penetration solar deployment projects in the region [Department of Energy](https://energy.gov/sites/prod/files/edg/recovery/documents/Recovery_Act_Memo_Illinois.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls critical grid interconnection infrastructure and has direct involvement in existing local renewable projects; historically significant political influence despite recent legal settlements.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate early with ComEd’s external affairs and transmission planning teams regarding interconnection; reference successful past collaborations like the McHenry Storage Project to demonstrate alignment with their grid modernization goals.

neighbors.profile_summary: Major utility partner with established renewable infrastructure in the county.

citations.title: Recovery Act Memo - Illinois

neighbors.name: Union Pacific Railroad Co
neighbors.claims: Union Pacific Railroad Company is a Class I freight railroad and the principal operating subsidiary of Union Pacific Corporation [Union Pacific](https://www.up.com/aboutup/corporate_info/uprrover/). In McHenry County, the railroad enforces strict "Right of Entry" permitting requirements for any work performed within its right-of-way, often requiring specific insurance and safety coordination [IDOT](https://apps.dot.illinois.gov/eplan/desenv/042525/194-61L18/61L18-194.pdf). The company generally prioritizes grade-separated crossings and rail safety over adjacent development interests, though it has been listed as a tax contact for solar projects in neighboring areas without noted opposition [Village of Maple Park](https://villageofmaplepark.org/wp-content/uploads/minutes-agendas-newsletters/Documents_2023-06-20.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls vital transportation corridor with federal preemption rights; strictly enforces safety and engineering standards for adjacent projects.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Union Pacific’s public projects department immediately if any transmission lines or access roads cross the rail corridor; expect a rigorous 'Right of Entry' permitting process.

neighbors.profile_summary: Transportation entity focused on corridor protection and safety compliance.

citations.claim: Union Pacific Railroad Company is a Class I freight railroad and the principal operating subsidiary of Union Pacific Corporation
citations.title: Union Pacific Corporation Overview

citations.claim: In McHenry County, the railroad enforces strict "Right of Entry" permitting requirements for any work performed within its right-of-way, often requiring specific insurance and safety coordination
citations.title: IDOT Contract 61L18 Special Provisions - McHenry County

citations.claim: it has been listed as a tax contact for solar projects in neighboring areas without noted opposition
citations.title: Village of Maple Park Board Meeting Minutes

neighbors.name: Freedom Lane LLC
neighbors.claims: Freedom Lane LLC is a Marengo-based entity that owns property in McHenry County, including the subject parcel and a property on Grant Highway [Xome](https://www.xome.com/realestate/24803-w-grant-hwy-marengo-il-60152-152725525). In late 2024, the entity expanded its local holdings by purchasing approximately 29 acres of vacant land on Lucas Road in Woodstock [The Woodstock Independent](https://issuu.com/thewoodstockindependent.com/docs/twi_woodstock_12-11-24). While specific beneficial owners are not disclosed in state filings, the entity's recent acquisition of vacant land suggests active investment or speculation in the area [The Woodstock Independent](https://issuu.com/thewoodstockindependent.com/docs/twi_woodstock_12-11-24).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local land holding entity with recent acquisition activity but no documented political or community leadership role.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a land investor; the recent purchase of vacant land indicates capital availability and potential interest in property value maximization.

neighbors.profile_summary: Active local land investor with recent vacant land acquisitions.
